root.description: A cold, stone celar is lit in a pale red light.

exit.description: A set of uneven stone [stairs] stagger upward.
exit.onCheck: Warm and torch light flow down the [stairs].

exit.description: Swirling red mist bars entrance to a magical [gate].
exit.onCheck: The [gate] lets nothing enter, but pours out malice and desire.

prop.description: The [nekker] sprawls on the floor, vanquished by the thrust of your silver blade.
prop.onCheck: It haunts this world no more, though looking upon it still bring dread.

prop.description: A stinking [carcass] rots before the red [gate].
prop.onCheck: It is the body of a wolf. It was stabbed several times.

prop.description: The [wolf] stands next to the boy.
prop.onCheck: It is calm, and yet it appears protective of [Joss].

character.description: The boy is indeed [Joss]. He has grown much in the past few years.
character.onCheck: His sour attitude seems deminished. The terror of the [nekker] and the support of the [wolf] may have cause a change in him.
character.onTalk:
Joss: "Can it be you? First this grey [wolf] and now the White Wolf comes to my aid! I am Joss, and I beg you to forgive me for my misleading words I spoke to you at our last meeting. I have been shaken to my core, and have grown because of it."
Geralt: "Good. So you can give me the truth, and all the truth. Are you alone down here?"
Joss: "I have this [wolf] with me. I followed him and his mate to the clearing in the woods. I thought they would kill me when he finally spotted me, but then that moster appeared from the hut and chased us down here. A can't tell you how many days ago that was."
Geralt: "What can you tell me?"
Joss: "That the wolves hated the moster more than they hated me. And that this is a witch's hut! That monster obeys her and watches us. She killed the second wolf tonight to open the [gate]. She threw some poor woman in there. I covered my face when the witch came, but I think the woman my have come from my own village."
Geralt: "A sacrifice to open the [gate], huh?"
Joss: "I suppose, but you mussn't hurt this [wolf]. He has saved my life."
